alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Lamar; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion, south central Forrest and southern Lamar Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 311 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sandy Hook, or 11 miles south of Columbia, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pine Burr around 325 PM CDT. Baxterville around 340 PM CDT. Lumberton and Pine Ridge around 355 PM CDT. Purvis around 400 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
